providers.doc: This is a default provider that does nothing. This allows us to install mysql on the same puppet run where we want to use it.
providers.name: default

providers.doc: Create mysql database.  Required binaries: `mysql`, `mysqladmin`, `mysqlshow`.    Default for `kernel` == `Linux`.
providers.name: mysql

properties.doc: The basic property that the resource should be in.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The characterset to use for a database  Values can match `/^\S+$/`.
properties.name: charset

parameters.doc: The primary key: either user@host for global privilges or user@host/database for database specific privileges
parameters.name: name

providers.doc: Uses mysql as database.  Required binaries: `mysql`, `mysqladmin`.    Default for `kernel` == `Linux`.
providers.name: mysql

properties.doc: The privileges the user should have. The possible values are implementation dependent.
properties.name: privileges

parameters.doc: The name of the user. This uses the 'username@hostname' or username@hosname.
parameters.name: name

types.doc: Manage a database user. This includes management of users password as well as priveleges

providers.doc: manage users for a mysql database.
providers.name: default

providers.doc: manage users for a mysql database.  Required binaries: `mysql`, `mysqladmin`.    Default for `kernel` == `Linux`.
providers.name: mysql

types.name: database_user

properties.doc: The basic property that the resource should be in.  Valid values are `present`, `absent`.
properties.name: ensure

properties.doc: The password hash of the user. Use mysql_password() for creating such a hash.  Values can match `/\w+/`.
properties.name: password_hash
